properties.description: The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: username
properties.description: • username - (Required) The email address associated with this user. Opsgenie defines that this must not be longer than 100 characters.

properties.name: full_name
properties.description: • full_name - (Required) The Full Name of the User.

properties.name: role
properties.description: • role - (Required) The Role assigned to the User. Either a built-in such as 'Owner', 'Admin' or 'User' - or the name of a custom role.

properties.name: locale
properties.description: • locale - (Optional) Location information for the user. Please look at Supported Locale Ids for available locales.

properties.name: timezone
properties.description: • timezone - (Optional) Timezone information of the user. Please look at Supported Timezone Ids for available timezones.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: username
properties.description: • username - (Required) The username for contact.(reference)

properties.name: to
properties.description: • to - (Required) to field is the address of given method.

properties.name: method
properties.description: • method - (Required) This parameter is the contact method of user and should be one of email, sms or voice. Please note that adding mobile is not supported from API.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: • enabled - (Optional) Enable contact of the user in OpsGenie. Default value is true.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) The name associated with this team. Opsgenie defines that this must not be longer than 100 characters.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) A description for this team.

properties.name: member
properties.description: • member - (Optional) A Member block as documented below.
member supports the following:

properties.name: id
properties.description: (Required) The UUID for the member to add to this Team.

properties.name: role
properties.description: (Optional) The role for the user within the Team
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Name of the integration. Name must be unique for each integration.

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Optional) Type of the integration. (API,Marid,Prometheus ...)

properties.name: allow_write_access
properties.description: • allow_write_access - (Optional) This parameter is for configuring the write access of integration. If write access is restricted, the integration will not be authorized to write within any domain. Defaults to true.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: • enabled - (Optional) This parameter is for specifying whether the integration will be enabled or not. Defaults to true

properties.name: ignore_responders_from_payload
properties.description: • ignore_responders_from_payload - (Optional) If enabled, the integration will ignore recipients sent in request payloads. Defaults to false.

properties.name: suppress_notifications
properties.description: • suppress_notifications - (Optional) If enabled, notifications that come from alerts will be suppressed. Defaults to false.

properties.name: owner_team_id
properties.description: • owner_team_id - (Optional) Owner team id of the integration.

properties.name: responder
properties.description: • responder - (Optional) User, schedule, teams or escalation names to calculate which users will receive the notifications of the alert.
responder supports the following:

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Required) The responder type.

properties.name: id
properties.description: (Required) The id of the responder.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Name of the integration. Name must be unique for each integration.

properties.name: email_username
properties.description: • email_username - (Required) The username part of the email address. It must be unique for each integration.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: • enabled - (Optional) A Member block as documented below.

properties.name: ignore_responders_from_payload
properties.description: • ignore_responders_from_payload - (Optional) If enabled, the integration will ignore recipients sent in request payloads. Defaults to false.

properties.name: suppress_notifications
properties.description: • suppress_notifications - (Optional) If enabled, notifications that come from alerts will be suppressed. Defaults to false.

properties.name: owner_team_id
properties.description: • owner_team_id - (Optional) Owner team id of the integration.

properties.name: responder
properties.description: • responder - (Optional) User, schedule, teams or escalation names to calculate which users will receive the notifications of the alert.
responder supports the following:

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Required) The responder type.

properties.name: id
properties.description: (Required) The id of the responder.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Name of the heartbeat

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) An optional description of the heartbeat

properties.name: interval_unit
properties.description: • interval_unit - (Required) Interval specified as minutes, hours or days.

properties.name: interval
properties.description: • interval - (Required) Specifies how often a heartbeat message should be expected.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: • enabled - (True) Enable/disable heartbeat monitoring.

properties.name: owner_team_id
properties.description: • owner_team_id - (Optional) Owner team of the heartbeat.

properties.name: alert_message
properties.description: • alert_message - (Optional) Specifies the alert message for heartbeat expiration alert. If this is not provided, default alert message is "HeartbeatName is expired".

properties.name: alert_priority
properties.description: • alert_priority - (Optional) Specifies the alert priority for heartbeat expiration alert. If this is not provided, default priority is P3.

properties.name: alert_tags
properties.description: • alert_tags - (Optional) Specifies the alert tags for heartbeat expiration alert.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Name of the escalation.

properties.name: rules
properties.description: • rules - (Required) List of the escalation rules.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) Description of the escalation.

properties.name: owner_team_id
properties.description: • owner_team_id - (Optional) Owner team id of the escalation.

properties.name: repeat
properties.description: • repeat - (Optional) Repeat preferences of the escalation including repeat interval, count, reverting acknowledge and seen states back and closing an alert automatically as soon as repeats are completed
rules supports the following:

properties.name: condition
properties.description: (Required) The condition for notifying the recipient of escalation rule that is based on the alert state. Possible values are: if-not-acked and if-not-closed. If not given, if-not-acked is used.

properties.name: notify_type
properties.description: • notify_type - (Required) Recipient calculation logic for schedules. Possible values are: default: on call users next: next users in rotation previous: previous users on rotation users: users of the team admins: admins of the team all: all members of the team

properties.name: recipient
properties.description: • recipient - (Required) Object of schedule, team, or users which will be notified in escalation. The possible values for participants are: user, schedule, team.

properties.name: delay
properties.description: • delay - (Required) Time delay of the escalation rule. This parameter takes an object that consists timeAmount field that takes time amount in minutes.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Required) Name of the schedule.

properties.name: rules
properties.description: • rules - (Required) A Member block as documented below.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) Timezone of schedule. Please look at Supported Timezone Ids for available timezones - Defaults to "America/New_York".

properties.name: timezone
properties.description: • timezone - (Optional) The description of schedule.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: • enabled - (Optional) Enable/disable state of schedule

properties.name: owner_team_id
properties.description: • owner_team_id - (Optional) Owner team id of the schedule.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: schedule_id
properties.description: • schedule_id - (Required) Identifier of the schedule.

properties.name: name
properties.description: • name - (Optional) Name of rotation.

properties.name: start_date
properties.description: • start_date - (Required) This parameter takes a date format as (yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ) (e.g. 2019-06-11T08:00:00+02:00). Minutes may take 0 or 30 as value. Otherwise they will be converted to nearest 0 or 30 automatically

properties.name: end_date
properties.description: • end_date - (Optional) This parameter takes a date format as (yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ) (e.g. 2019-06-11T08:00:00+02:00). Minutes may take 0 or 30 as value. Otherwise they will be converted to nearest 0 or 30 automatically

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Required) Type of rotation. May be one of daily, weekly and hourly.

properties.name: length
properties.description: • length - (Required) Length of the rotation with default value 1.

properties.name: participant
properties.description: • participant - (Required) List of escalations, teams, users or the reserved word none which will be used in schedule. Each of them can be used multiple times and will be rotated in the order they given. "user,escalation,team,none"

properties.name: time_restriction
properties.description: • time_restriction - (Required)
participant supports the following:

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Required) The responder type.

properties.name: id
properties.description: (Required) The id of the responder.
time_restriction supports the following:

properties.name: type
properties.description: • type - (Required) This parameter should be set time-of-day

properties.name: list description
properties.description: restriction - (Required) It is a restriction object which is described below. In this case startDay/endDay fields are not supported.

properties.name: start_hour
properties.description: (Required) Value of the hour that frame will start

properties.name: start_min
properties.description: (Required) Value of the minute that frame will start. Minutes may take 0 or 30 as value. Otherwise they will be converted to nearest 0 or 30 automatically.

properties.name: end_hour
properties.description: (Required) Value of the hour that frame will end.

properties.name: end_min
properties.description: (Required) Value of the minute that frame will end. Minutes may take 0 or 30 as value. Otherwise they will be converted to nearest 0 or 30 automatically.
The following arguments are supported:

properties.name: time
properties.description: • time - (Required) Time configuration of maintenance. It takes a time object which has type, startDate and endDate fields

properties.name: rules
properties.description: • rules - (Required) Rules of maintenance, which takes a list of rule objects and defines the maintenance rules over integrations and policies.

properties.name: description
properties.description: • description - (Optional) Description for the maintenance.
times supports the following:

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Required) This parameter defines when the maintenance will be active. It can take one of for-5-minutes, for-30-minutes, for-1-hour, indefinitely or schedule.

properties.name: start_date
properties.description: (Required) This parameter takes a date format as (yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ) (e.g. 2019-06-11T08:00:00+02:00).

properties.name: end_date
properties.description: (Required) This parameter takes a date format as (yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ) (e.g. 2019-06-11T08:00:00+02:00).
rules supports the following:

properties.name: list description
properties.description: entity - (Required) This field represents the entity that maintenance will be applied. Entity field takes two mandatory fields as id and type.

properties.name: id
properties.description: (Required) The id of the entity that maintenance will be applied.

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Required) The type of the entity that maintenance will be applied. It can be either integration or policy.

properties.name: state
properties.description: • state - (Required) State of rule that will be defined in maintenance and can take either enabled or disabled for policy type rules. This field has to be disabled for integration type entity rules.
